row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: New NIPA handbook chapters, stay connectd to BEA

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2011
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP rose 1.8 percent after rising 1.3 percent in the second quarter. Consumer spending, nonresidential investment, and exports picked up. State and local government spending decreased less.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the Third Quarter of 2011
row.Description: Updated statistics, including statistics on inventories for manufacturing by stage of fabrication.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions for the Third Quarter of 2011
row.Author: Sarah P. Scott
row.Description: The U.S. current-account deficit decreased $14.4 billion to $110.3 billion, mainly reflecting a drop in the deficit on goods. In the financial account, net financial inflows increased $148.5 billion to $183.9 billion.

row.Title: An Ownership-Based Framework of the U.S. Current Account for 1999â€“2010
row.Author: Jeffrey H. Lowe
row.Description: An annual supplement to the international accounts presents current-account statistics that combine cross-border trade and net receipts of affiliates of multinational companies.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze, Thomas M. Wiederhold
row.Description: In the third quarter of 2011, state personal income grew in 30 states; in the other 20 states, it fell or was unchanged. In 2010, compensation rebounded, increasing in 2,480 of the 3,113 counties.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: New NIPA handbook chapters, stay connectd to BEA

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2011
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP rose 2.8 percent after rising 1.8 percent in the third quarter. Inventory investment turned up, and consumer spending and residential investment accelerated. For the year 2011, real GDP rose 1.7 percent after rising 3.0 percent in 2010.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: The Role of Profits and Income in the Statistical Discrepancy
row.Author: Dylan G. Rassier
row.Description: A look at estimation issues regarding corporate profits and income and how these issues might affect the statistical discrepancy, the difference between gross domestic product and gross domestic income.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA economist studies U.S. plant shutdowns

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2011
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP rose 3.0 percent after rising 1.8 percent in the third quarter. Inventory investment turned up, and consumer spending and residential investment picked up.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: NIPA Translation of the Fiscal Year 2013 Federal Budget
row.Author: Mark S. Ludwick,Stan J. Bellotti
row.Description: BEA prepares federal government estimates that are based on the proposed budget of the U.S. government. This analysis is often used to gauge the effects of the federal budget on U.S. economic activity.
row.Category: National, NIPA translation of the federal budget

row.Title: Alternative Measures of Personal Saving
row.Author: Elizabeth C. Bernstein
row.Description: BEA publishes a variety of alternative measures of saving about every 2 years to complement the widely watched NIPA measure of personal saving.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Travel and tourism, FAQs, economy at a glance

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2011
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP rose 3.0 percent after rising 1.8 percent in the third quarter. Inventory investment turned up, and consumer spending and residential investment picked up. Federal government spending turned down, and state and local government spending decreased more.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures for the Fourth Quarter of 2011
row.Author: Stan J. Bellotti
row.Description: Net government saving increased $67.3 billion to â€“$1,176.6 billion. Net federal government saving rose $65.6 billion to â€“$1,095.1 billion. Net state and local government saving rose $1.7 billion to â€“$81.5 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the Fourth Quarter of 2011
row.Description: Updated statistics, including statistics on inventories for manufacturing by state of fabrication.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: Estimates of Categories of Personal Consumption Expenditures Adjusted for Net Foreign Travel Spending
row.Author: Michael Armah, Teresita Teensma
row.Description: BEA research separates spending by nonresidents traveling in the United States from spending by U.S. residents, providing a more detailed look at consumer spending.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions for the Fourth Quarter of 2011 and for 2011
row.Author: Sarah P. Scott, Alexis N. Chaves
row.Description: The U.S. current-account deficit rose $16.5 billion to $124.1 billion in the fourth quarter, as the surplus on income declined and the deficit on goods and services increased. In 2011, the current-account deficit increased $2.5 billion to $473.4 billion.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: State personal income growth ranged from 0.5 percent in Wisconsin to 1.5 percent in North Dakota in the fourth quarter of 2011. In 2011, growth ranged from 3.4 percent in Maine to 8.1 percent in North Dakota.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Summary MNC activity, new FAQ

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the First Quarter of 2012
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP rose 2.2 percent after rising 3.0 percent in the fourth quarter of 2011. Consumer spending picked up. Inventory investment slowed, and residential investment turned down.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Annual Industry Accounts: Advance Statistics on GDP by Industry for 2011
row.Author: Donald D. Kim, Teresa L. Gilmore, William A. Jolliff
row.Description: Economic growth slowed in 2011, increasing 1.7 percent after increasing 3.0 percent in 2010. The largest contributors to the growth were durable-goods manufacturing; professional, scientific, and technical services; and information services.

row.Title: Accounting for Household Production in the National Accounts, 1965â€“2010
row.Description: A satellite account adjusts gross domestic product to account for three types of home production activities: production of nonmarket services, a return to consumer durable goods, and a return to government capital attributable to home production.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Modernizing and Enhancing BEA's International Economic Accounts: A Progress Report
row.Author: Kristy L. Howell
row.Description: An update on BEA's efforts to modernize these accounts to better align them with updated international guidelines.

row.Title: Local Area Personal Income for 2010
row.Author: Jeffrey L. Newman
row.Description: Personal income grew in 2,932 counties, decreased in 175 counties, and was unchanged in 6 counties in 2010.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Personal income measures

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the First Quarter of 2012
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP rose 1.9 percent after rising 3.0 percent in the fourth quarter of 2011. Consumer spending picked up. Inventory investment slowed, and residential investment turned down.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures for the First Quarter of 2012
row.Author: Stan J. Bellotti
row.Description: Net government saving rose $108.9 billion to â€“$1,086.6 billion. Net federal government saving rose $115.2 billion to â€“$998.9 billion. Net state and local government saving fell $6.2 billion to â€“$87.7 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Returns for Domestic Nonfinancial Business
row.Author: Andrew W. Hodge, Robert J. Corea, James M. Green, Bonnie A. Retus
row.Description: Aggregate rates of return for nonfinancial corporations, industries, and selected industry groups as well as various Q ratios. Domestic nonfinancial corporate returns rose in 2011.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: U.S. Travel and Tourism Satellite Accounts for 2003â€“2011
row.Author: Steven L. Zemanek
row.Description: In 2011, the travel and tourism industry increased 3.1 percent after increasing 2.9 percent in 2010. Tourism employment grew 1.8 percent after decreasing in 2009 and 2010.
row.Category: Industry, Travel and tourism satellite accounts

row.Title: Household Consumption Expenditures for Medical Care: An Alternate Presentation
row.Author: Ana Aizcorbe, Eli B. Liebman, David M. Cutler, Allison B. Rosen
row.Description: As part of its ongoing efforts to develop health care economic accounts, BEA provides an alternative look at household spending on health care, showing how spending by disease compares with spending by commodity categories.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Prototype Quarterly Statistics on U.S. Gross Domestic Product by Industry, 2007â€“2011
row.Author: Erich H. Strassner, David B. Wasshausen
row.Description: The third in a series of articles about BEA's plans to regularly release quarterly statistics on GDP by industry.

row.Title: A Profile of U.S. Exporters and Importers of Services
row.Author: Kevin Barefoot, Jennifer Koncz-Bruner
row.Description: A new look at services exporters and importers, based on a new data set that combines information on cross-border services trade with data on the operations of multinational companies for 2008.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Physician concentration and health care spending

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the First Quarter of 2012
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP rose 1.9 percent after rising 3.0 percent in the fourth quarter of 2011. Consumer spending and residential investment picked up, while inventory investment slowed.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the First Quarter of 2012
row.Description: These statistics, including those for inventories for manufacturing by state of fabrication, have been updated.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: The International Investment Position of the United States at Yearend 2011
row.Author: Elena L. Nguyen
row.Description: The net international investment position was â€“$4,030.3 billion; in 2010, it was â€“$2,473.6 billion. U.S.-owned assets abroad increased $834.0 billion to $21,132.4 billion, and foreign-owned assets in the United States increased $2,390.6 billion to $25,162.6 billion.

row.Title: Direct Investment Positions for 2011: Country and Industry Detail
row.Author: Kevin B. Barefoot, Marilyn Ibarra-Caton
row.Description: The U.S. direct investment abroad position grew 10 percent after growing 8 percent in 2010. The foreign direct investment in the United States position grew 13 percent after growing 9 percent.

row.Title: Annual Revision of the U.S. International Transactions Accounts
row.Author: Jeffrey R. Bogen, Jessica M. Hanson
row.Description: Each year, statistics on U.S. international transactions are revised to incorporate revised data and statistical improvements. Several changes were introduced this year to align the accounts with the updated international guidelines.

row.Title: How BEA Aligns and Augments Source Data From the U.S. Treasury Department for Inclusion in the U.S. International Transactions Accounts
row.Description: Each year, the estimates of financial-account flows in these accounts, which are based on Treasury Department data, are adjusted to align the estimates with balance of payments concepts and close the gaps in coverage.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: First Quarter of 2012
row.Author: Sarah P. Scott
row.Description: The current-account deficit increased $18.7 billion to $137.3 billion. In the financial account, net financial inflows increased $93.3 billion to $156.7 billion.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions and Positions in Financial Derivatives
row.Description: Statistics on transactions in financial derivatives by type of contract and by area and country for 2009â€“2011.

row.Title: Gross Domestic Product by State: Advance Statistics for 2011 and Revised Statistics for 1997â€“2010
row.Author: Frank T. Baumgardner, LeRoynda Brooks, Lam X. Cao
row.Description: Real GDP increased in 43 states and the District of Columbia in 2011. In 2011, real GDP increased 1.5 percent. In the eight BEA regions, real GDP slowed.
row.Category: Regional, Gross domestic product by state

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: Personal income rose in 47 states and the District of Columbia in the first quarter of 2012; it fell in Kansas and Mississippi and was unchanged in Oklahoma. Growth ranged from 2.3 percent in North Dakota to â€“0.3 percent in Mississippi.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA co-hosts IARIW conference in Boston

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2012 (
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 1.5 percent after increasing 2.0 percent in first quarter. Consumer spending, business investment, and residential investment slowed. Inventory investment turned up.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Annual Revision of the National Income and Product Accounts Annual Estimates for 2009â€“2011 and Quarterly Estimates for 2009:Iâ€“2012:I
row.Author: Eugene P. Seskin, Alyssa E. Holdren
row.Description: Details of the 2012 annual revision, which incorporated newly available source data, new methodologies, and new presentations.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: National Income and Product Accounts Tables
row.Description: Annual, quarterly, and monthly statistics from the annual NIPA revision, including advance estimates for the second quarter of 2012 and preliminary estimates for June 2012.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)
row.Supp1_Title: Summary National Income and Product Accounts

row.Title: GDP and Other Major NIPA Series for 1929â€“2012:II
row.Description: Historical statistics on GDP and its components in current dollars, chained dollars, and chain-type quantity and price indexes, including statistics on national income and personal income.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: U.S. Affiliates of Foreign Companies: Operations in 2010
row.Author: Thomas Anderson
row.Description: The current-dollar value added of these affiliates rose 9.6 percent to $649.3 billion. Employment by these affiliates fell 0.4 percent.
row.Category: International, Foreign direct investment in the United States

row.Title: Regional Price Parities for States and Metropolitan Areas for 2006â€“2010
row.Author: Bettina H. Aten, Eric B. Figueroa, Troy M. Martin
row.Description: Three sets of regional price parities, which show price level differences across geographic areas, are presented for states, state metropolitan and nonmetropolitan areas, and metropolitan areas.
row.Category: Regional, Regional price parities for states and metropolitan areas

row.Title: An Examination of Revisions to the Quarterly Estimates of State Personal Income
row.Author: Matthew A. von Kerczek, B. Enrique Lopez
row.Description: A statistical analysis of the patterns and magnitudes of the revisions to state personal income estimates as the estimates move through the revision cycle.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: RIMS II multipliers

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2012
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 1.7 percent after increasing 2.0 percent in first quarter. Consumer spending, business investment, and residential investment slowed. Government spending and inventory investment decreased less in the second quarter than in the first quarter.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: Second Quarter of 2012
row.Author: Stan J. Bellotti
row.Description: Net government saving decreased $20.7 billion to â€“$1,207.1 billion. Net federal government saving decreased $35.8 billion to â€“$1,094.5 billion. Net state and local government saving increased $14.9 billion to â€“$112.7 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Newly Available NIPA Tables
row.Description: Statistics on federal and state and local government spending by function and a comparison of NIPA and USDA net farm income that reflect the 2012 annual NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Fixed Assets and Consumer Durable Goods for 2008â€“2011
row.Author: Marlyn Rodriguez, Robert J. Kornfeld, Jennifer A. Bennett, Mark Bailey, Michael T. Cusick, Michael D. Glenn, Mark A. Ledbetter, Christopher B. Mbu, Nadia F.P. SadÃ©e
row.Description: Statistics on the net stock of equipment and software, on business and government structures, and on consumer durable goods that reflect the 2012 annual NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, Fixed assets and consumer durable goods

row.Title: Direct Investment for 2009â€“2011: Detailed Historical-Cost Positions and Related Financial and Income Flows
row.Author: Jeffrey H. Lowe
row.Description: Statistics on (1) the direct investment positions and international transactions of U.S. and foreign multinational companies and (2) the composition of investment by U.S. companies abroad and foreign companies in the United States.
row.Supp2_Title: Foreign Direct Investment in the United States Tables

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: New R&D data on multinational companies

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2012
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 1.3 percent after increasing 2.0 percent in first quarter. Consumer spending, business investment, and residential investment slowed. Government spending decreased less in the second quarter than in the first quarter.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)
row.Supp1_Title: Effects of the 2012 Midwest Drought on the NIPA Estimates

row.Title: Newly Available NIPA Tables
row.Description: These tables present (1) statistics on federal government receipts and expenditures and the budget, (2) state government and local government receipts and expenditures, and (3) not seasonally adjusted government estimates. All reflect the 2012 annual NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the Fourth Quarter of 2008 to the Second Quarter of 2012
row.Description: These statistics, including those for inventories for manufacturing by stage of fabrication, have been updated to reflect the 2012 annual NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: U.S. International Services: Cross-Border Trade in 2011 and Services Supplied Through Affiliates in 2010
row.Author: Marilyn Ibarra-Caton, Charu Sharma
row.Description: In 2011, the surplus on the cross-border trade in private services was $193.8 billion. In 2010, services supplied by foreign affiliates of U.S. multinational companies exceeded the services supplied by the U.S. affiliates of foreign multinational companies by $434.5 billion.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions for the Second Quarter of 2012
row.Author: Sarah P. Scott
row.Description: The U.S. current-account deficit decreased $16.2 billion to $117.4 billion. In the financial account, net financial inflows decreased $76.2 billion to $88.5 billion.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: In the second quarter of 2012, state personal income growth ranged from 2.1 percent in North Dakota to 0.4 percent in New Mexico. Growth slowed in 39 states and the District of Columbia, picked up in 10 states, and was unchanged in Nevada.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA economists discusses revisions at IARIW event

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2012
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP growth picked up, rising 2.0 percent after rising 1.3 percent in the second quarter. Consumer spending on goods accelerated. Federal government spending turned up, reflecting an upturn in national defense spending.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Newly Available NIPA Tables
row.Description: Two new tables are available: (1) personal income and its disposition by households and nonprofits and (2) BEA income and outlays of nonprofits compared with IRS revenue and expense data.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Updated Summary of NIPA Methodologies
row.Description: The data and methods used to prepare current-dollar and real estimates of GDP as well as current-dollar estimates of gross domestic income, reflecting the 2012 annual NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Territorial Economic Accounts for American Samoa, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, and the U.S. Virgin Islands
row.Author: Aya Hamano
row.Description: Updated estimates of GDP and expanded accounts that include estimates of GDP by industry and compensation by industry and more detailed estimates of consumer spending for 2002â€“2010.

row.Title: A Prototype BEA/BLS Industry-Level Production Account for the United States
row.Author: Susan Fleck, Steven Rosenthal, Matthew Russell, Erich H. Strassner, Lisa Usher
row.Description: BEA and BLS have integrated GDP by industry statistics with productivity statistics, providing new details on industry sources of aggregate economic growth.

row.Title: U.S. Multinational Companies: Operations of U.S. Parents and Their Foreign Affiliates in 2010
row.Author: Kevin B. Barefoot
row.Description: The value added of U.S. multinational companies increased 10.3 percent. The value added of U.S. parents increased 11.2 percent, and the value added of their foreign affiliates increased 8.4 percent. Worldwide employment of U.S. multinational companies increased 0.5 percent.

row.Title: An Analysis of Revisions to BEA's International Economic Accounts
row.Author: Daniel R. Yorgason, Sarah P. Scott
row.Description: A study of revisions to the first published estimates of the quarterly international transactions accounts for 1999â€“2011 shows that the accounts provide an accurate picture of economic activity between U.S. residents and foreigners.

row.Title: Schedule of BEA News Releases in 2013
Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Guide on citing BEA information, expanded integrated macroeconomic statistics

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2012
row.Author: Shelly Smith
row.Description: Real GDP growth picked up, rising 2.7 percent after rising 1.3 percent in the second quarter. Private inventory investment and federal government spending turned up, and residential investment picked up.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures for the Third Quarter of 2012
row.Description: Net government saving increased $26.4 billion to â€“$1,212.6 billion. Net federal government saving increased $41.9 billion to â€“$1,073.5 billion. Net state and local government saving decreased $15.4 billion to â€“$139.1 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Annual Industry Accounts: Revised Statistics for 2009â€“2011
row.Description: Real GDP by industry slowed in 2011, increasing 1.8 percent after increasing 2.4 percent in 2010. In 2011, 12 of the 22 major industry groups contributed to the slowdown.

row.Title: Subject Guide
row.Description: A list of the articles published in the Survey of Current Business in 2012.

row.Title: Schedule of BEA News Releases in 2013
